dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 1312 IH: National Health Service Corps Improvement Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. McMorris Rodgers (for herself, Ms. Castor of Florida, Mr. Guthrie, Mr. Kinzinger of Illinois, Mr. Long, Mr. Griffith, and Mr. Schrader) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to provide for the participation of optometrists in the National Health Service Corps scholarship and loan repayment programs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Health Service Corps Improvement Act of 2015.

section.header: Participation of optometrists in National Health Service Corps

paragraph.text: Section 331 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 254d) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)(3)(D), by striking or mental health, and inserting optometry, or mental health,; and
in subsection (b)(2), by striking and physician assistants and inserting optometrists, and physician assistants.

paragraph.text: Section 338A of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 254l) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)(1), by striking and physician assistants and inserting optometrists, and physician assistants; and
in subsection (b)(1), by striking or other health profession and inserting optometry, or other health profession.
Section 338B of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 254l–1) is amended—

clause.text: in subsection (a)(1), by striking and physician assistants and inserting optometrists, and physician assistants;
in subsection (b)(1)(A), by striking or another health profession and inserting optometry, or another health profession; and
in subsections (b)(1)(B) and (b)(1)(C)(ii), by striking the term or other health profession each place such term appears and inserting optometry, or other health profession.

subparagraph.text: Clauses (ii) and (iii) of section 338C(b)(5)(C) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 254m(b)(5)(C)) are amended by striking the term or other health profession each place such term appears and inserting optometry, or other health profession.
